rooms.description: A wide entrance area with a wheelchair-accessible path that adheres to Vastu principles by aligning east or north, ensuring an inviting energy. The space is open and connects directly to the central courtyard.
A combined living and dining space facing the central courtyard. Designed with high ceilings, Kerala-style wooden beams and traditional stone flooring, ensuring a natural light and open feel.
A compact yet efficient kitchen area designed for joint family usage, positioned per Vastu guidelines (south or southwest) with modern amenities and traditional Kerala design elements.
A spacious master bedroom with an en-suite bathroom, ensuring privacy and comfort. The bedroom is designed to face the courtyard for a calming view.
A dedicated space for servants, ensuring privacy and functionality. Positioned towards the north or east per Vastu guidelines to promote positivity.

openings.description: The primary entrance is designed for wheelchair accessibility with a ramp leading from the ground-level parking area into the villa. It aligns with Vastu principles by facing north or east, ensuring optimal energy flow.
A secondary entrance opening that provides direct access to the central courtyard. This area is designed with a wide archway and natural stone accents in Kerala style.
A discreet entrance for servants' quarters that maintains privacy while ensuring functionality. This opening adheres to Vastu principles by avoiding direct alignment with main entrances.
A small balcony adjacent to the master bedroom, designed for fresh air and relaxation. It is positioned with respect to Vastu principles ensuring positive energy.
